item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Let me tell you this: if you meet a loner, no matter what they tell you, it's not because they enjoy solitude. It's because they have tried to blend into the world before, and people continue to disappoint them." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Every day one should at least hear one little song, read one good poem, see one fine painting and -- if at all possible -- speak a few sensible words." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Every fairy tale had a bloody lining. Every one had teeth and claws." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "Like all magnificent things, it's very simple." -- Natalie Babbitt

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Am I hideous, Jane? Very, sir: you always were, you know." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Arthur Rubenstein
item.description: "I have found that when you love life, life will love you return." -- Arthur Rubenstein

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Hazel Osmond
item.description: "Jack shook his head. 'Books. What is it with women and books? My sisters were the same. They were always buying books for boys they fancied.' Ellie bent down and picked up the stone and put it on the table. 'It's like sending a love letter without having to write it yourself,' she said softly." -- Hazel Osmond

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "As you grow up, always tell the truth, do no harm to others, and don't think you are the most important being on earth. Rich or poor, you then can look anyone in the eye and say, 'I'm probably no better than you, but I'm certainly your equal." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Janice (Janicu) add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "When one is traveling, everything looks brighter and lovelier. That does not mean it IS brighter and lovelier; it just means that sweet, kindly home suffers in comparison to tarted-up foreign places with all their jewels on." -- Catherynne M. Valente
